description: Improper neutralization of special elements used in SQL commands allows attackers to execute arbitrary SQL queries
remediation: Use parameterized queries and input validation

description: Improper neutralization of input allows injection of malicious scripts into web pages
remediation: Input validation and output encoding

description: Web application does not verify that requests are intentionally provided by the user
remediation: Implement CSRF tokens and SameSite cookies

description: Application provides direct access to objects based on user-supplied input
remediation: Implement proper access controls and authorization checks

description: XML processor evaluates external entity references within XML documents
remediation: Disable external entity processing and use less complex data formats

description: Server-side application can be induced to make requests to unintended locations
remediation: Validate and sanitize all user-supplied URLs and implement network segmentation

description: Authentication mechanisms are implemented incorrectly allowing attackers to compromise passwords or session tokens
remediation: Implement multi-factor authentication and secure session management

description: Applications do not adequately protect sensitive data such as financial and healthcare information
remediation: Encrypt sensitive data at rest and in transit

description: Applications and frameworks come with default configurations that are often insecure
remediation: Review and harden all security configurations regularly

description: Applications frequently use components with known vulnerabilities
remediation: Maintain an inventory of components and regularly update them

description: Insufficient logging and monitoring coupled with missing incident response
remediation: Implement comprehensive logging and monitoring with real-time alerting

description: Program writes more data to a buffer than it can hold leading to memory corruption
remediation: Use memory-safe programming languages and implement bounds checking

description: Multiple threads access shared data simultaneously without proper synchronization
remediation: Implement proper synchronization mechanisms and atomic operations

description: Security check and resource use are not atomic operations
remediation: Minimize time between security checks and resource usage

description: User gains elevated access to resources that are normally protected
remediation: Implement principle of least privilege and regular access reviews

description: Execution of arbitrary commands on the host operating system via vulnerable application
remediation: Validate and sanitize all user input and avoid system command execution

description: User can access files and directories outside the web document root
remediation: Validate and sanitize file paths and implement access controls

description: Use of weak cryptographic algorithms or improper implementation
remediation: Use strong cryptographic algorithms and proper key management

description: Credentials are hardcoded in source code or configuration files
remediation: Remove hardcoded credentials and use secure credential management

description: System becomes unavailable to legitimate users
remediation: Implement rate limiting and resource management

description: Application logic can be circumvented to achieve unintended behavior
remediation: Review business logic implementation and add validation

description: Sensitive information is exposed to unauthorized parties
remediation: Remove sensitive information from responses and implement proper access controls

description: Session identifier is not properly regenerated after authentication
remediation: Regenerate session identifiers after authentication

description: User interface is overlaid to trick users into clicking on unintended elements
remediation: Implement X-Frame-Options header and Content Security Policy

description: HTTP response headers can be manipulated to inject arbitrary content
remediation: Validate and sanitize all user input used in HTTP headers

description: Malicious LDAP statements are inserted into application queries
remediation: Use parameterized LDAP queries and input validation

description: Malicious XML content is inserted into XML documents
remediation: Validate and sanitize XML input and use XML schema validation

description: HTTP Host header can be manipulated to redirect requests
remediation: Validate Host header against whitelist of allowed values

description: JSON Web Token implementation vulnerabilities
remediation: Proper JWT validation and secure algorithm selection

description: Malicious GraphQL queries can access unauthorized data
remediation: Implement query complexity analysis and depth limiting
